commentary.line: Whether they do so remains to be seen. It has been fun bringing you the game today. Do join us for all the action from the remainder of the series. There is IPL and a Test match going on - if you still want your cricket fix. Head over there. Until next time it's goodbye from all of us here. Remember to sleep tight! Sayonara!

For Pakistan this is a hard lesson for young Azhar Ali and Co. Granted a few seniors have left but losing a series 0-3 is not what they would've envisaged before the start of this tour. They have been comprehensively outplayed by hungrier opposition. The tour isn't over. There is still a T20 and a couple of Tests to follow. So Pakistan would be hoping to turn a corner there.

So after failing to win an ODI for close to 15 years and 320 days against Pakistan, Bangladesh have 'Banglawashed' Pakistan in the space of 6 days. And they have done it with style, passion, flair and gumption. Pakistan were thrashed in all the three games. The last two games Bangladesh chased 250 as if they had an appointment elsewhere. Terrific all-round performance by them as a team. They have completely annihilated the opposition.

Tamim: 'Finally I'm enjoying my batting. That is the main thing. Thanks to the team and the coaching staff, they supported me when I wasn't doing well. Special thanks to Mushy and Mash - they were brilliant and were always talking to me and gave me confidence when I wasn't getting runs. We dominated the series. The boys showed their character and Bangladesh is ready to take another step. We always believe that we have the talent to play against the big boys and now is the time to show them'
Tamim Iqbal is the Man of the Series for his 312 runs in the series.
Unfortunately he is speaking in Bangla and I have no clue. So can't bring you guys what he says. Sorry!
Soumya Sarkar is the Man of the Match for his stunning innings

Mortaza: 'The way the boys are playing it is very pleasing for me and the team as well. The boys are performing every day which is good. Tamim has been brilliant whole tournament as was Soumya today. We have got the confidence and we delivered in the middle. Our main focus will be the T20 day after and then the Test match.'

Azhar Ali: 'I would like to congratulate the Bangladeshi team. Their team management needs applauding. They played good cricket. Our team played well in patches. But we didn't put it together. We need to come back well and play as a combined unit. A few senior players are missing. The youngsters have to stand up. We didn't do it this series. We need to put our hands up and perform as unit. In T20s and Tests we have some experienced guys and you will see an improved performance there.'

Rahim: 'It is a great moment for Bangladesh cricket. We have whitewashed a few other teams but to whitewash Pakistan is a great achievement. Someone puts their hands up and does their job. My job is to bat as many overs as I can and score runs. I want to keep this going.'

Another comprehensive win for Bangladesh. Chasing 251, openers Soumya Sarkar and Tamim Iqbal shared an excellent 145-run stand, before the latter was dismissed. Tamim completed his 29th ODI fifty and this is the first time in the series that he was dismissed before scoring a hundred. Although Mahmudullah went soon after, Sarkar carried on and completed his maiden ODI hundred. Mushfiqur Rahim then gave Sarkar good company and the duo took Bangladesh past the line to sweep the ODI series 3-0. Although Junaid Khan picked up two wickets, he was very expensive. Umar Gul wasn't impressive in his comeback game either. Mohammad Hafeez being cleared to bowl by the ICC came as big boost for Pakistan, but he could not give them a breakthrough, despite bowling an economical spell.

It is a carnival atmosphere at the Sher-e-Bangla tonight. The crowd are going mental. The players walk off and the Pakistanis wait to shake hands with their counterparts. Mortaza is all smiles. As are all the Bangladeshis. 'It is a magical moment' says Athar Ali Khan on air and I agree. Bangladesh may have reached the World Cup quarter-final but sweeping Pakistan 3-0 is perhaps their greatest achievement in ODIs.

39.3   Junaid Khan to Rahim, FOUR, Pakistan have been Banglawashed! All over! Down leg, Rahim had to get bat on it and just did that, glancing it down to fine leg, beating short fine inside the ring. Rahim lets out a mighty roar after hitting the winning runs. He has his hands aloft in joy and hugs Soumya Sarkar
Now round the wicket
39.2   Junaid Khan to Rahim, 2 runs, he tried but couldn't. Steps out and it is short, Rahim upper cuts wide of third man. Only a two as the fielder gets across and stops
Can Rahim finish it off on a high?

39.2   Junaid Khan to Rahim, no ball, FOUR, did Rahim hear the no-ball call? It doesn't matter now as Rahim charges Junaid Khan and smashes it straight back over the bowler's head. Connected well and now it will be a free-hit
39.1   Junaid Khan to Rahim, no run, good length outside off, Rahim tries to run it down and is beaten. Was too close to be playing that shot
Junaid Khan [7.0-0-56-2] is back into the attack
Six singles off the over
38.6   Riaz to Rahim, 1 run, pitched up outside off, Rahim gets forward and drives to mid-off, takes the quick single
38.5   Riaz to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, Soumya Sarkar shuffles across outside off and wrists that short-arm pull to deep backward square leg, another single
38.4   Riaz to Rahim, 1 run, short of length, sliding across Rahim who runs it down with an open face to third man
38.3   Riaz to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, Riaz follows Soumya Sarkar with a pacy back of a length delivery on leg, the batsman makes room and dabs it to third man
38.2   Riaz to Rahim, 1 run, good length outside off, Rahim opens the face of the bat and runs it down to third man
38.1   Riaz to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, short of length outside off, dabbed with an open face to third man
Wahab Riaz [5.0-0-24-0] is back into the attack
37.6   Umar Gul to Rahim, 2 runs, short of length outside off, dabbed down to third man. Babar has work to do and does so well, running around to his left and cutting it off. Saves two
37.5   Umar Gul to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, on the pads, flicked to deep mid-wicket, sensible batting
A discussion about field placements as Umar Gul takes a breather

37.4   Umar Gul to Soumya Sarkar, SIX, Soumya Sarkar is in overdrive now. He comes down the track and sends the length ball from Umar Gul soaring into the stands at deep mid-wicket. Soumya Sarkar gave it plenty and it carried way back. Umar Gul just stood there and grimaced. This is exceptional batting from the young Sarkar. He is toying with one of the best death bowlers in the world

37.3   Umar Gul to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR, now one bounce over the ropes and a four to deep mid-wicket. Slower short ball outside off, Soumya Sarkar was waiting on the back foot and hammered the pull beating two fielders on the leg-side boundary

37.2   Umar Gul to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR, that has been rifled past the left-hand of Umar Gul. Full on the stumps, Soumya Sarkar shows the full face of the bat and drills it in the air over the bowler. That went away very quickly to the fence
37.1   Umar Gul to Rahim, 1 run, good length outside off, Rahim opens the face of the bat and steers to third man

36.6   Babar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, very optimistic from Babar, Soumya Sarkar is beaten on the sweep, the line is middle and leg and it hits the batsman high on the pad. The umpire rightly rules it not out

36.5   Babar to Soumya Sarkar, SIX, all the fielders are in on the off-side, Soumya Sarkar goes over mid-off. Uses his feet and then whips the loft over the infield. Just about carries all the way. Soumya Sarkar and Rahim punch gloves. Soumya Sarkar has a big smile on his face
36.4   Babar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, short down leg, Babar gets away, Soumya Sarkar pulls straight to the fielder at short fine
36.3   Babar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, turning in, clipped straight to the fielder at mid-wicket. Was in the air, but fell short
36.2   Babar to Rahim, 1 run, allows the length ball to turn across him and then nudges it off the back foot wide of mid-wicket
36.1   Babar to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, Soumya Sarkar uses his feet and drags the loft to long-on

35.6   Umar Gul to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, straight in and straight out. That is a sitter and Junaid has dropped it at deep mid-wicket. Short on the stumps, Soumya Sarkar pulls and Junaid after getting both hands shells it. Nothing going right for Pakistan

35.5   Umar Gul to Soumya Sarkar, no run, was that dropped? Need a replay. Soumya Sarkar missed a hook to a very short delivery and Rizwan fumbled after leaping. Cannot glove that and the umpire signals one short ball for the over

35.4   Umar Gul to Soumya Sarkar, no run, pitched up on off, Soumya Sarkar drills that hard towards Rahim and looks like it has deflected off Rahim's bat, that spoils all timing and rolls to mid-off. Soumya Sarkar hit that really well
35.3   Umar Gul to Rahim, 1 run, good length outside off, steered down to third man
35.2   Umar Gul to Rahim, no run, short of length on off, Rahim defends solidly to short cover
This is now batting powerplay time
35.1   Umar Gul to Rahim, FOUR, the runs keep flowing. Short and wide outside off, Rahim cuts in the air and wide of backward point's left. Third man can't get across in time
Umar Gul [5.0-0-29-0] is back into the attack
34.6   Babar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, tossed up outside off, Soumya Sarkar attempts a reverse sweep and is hit on the right bicep

34.5   Babar to Rahim, 3 runs, turn and bounce for Babar, produces the outside edge but it falls in front of Hafeez at first slip and runs through his hands. They take three. Lovely delivery from Babar, angled in and spun away after pitching, opened Rahim up completely
34.4   Babar to Rahim, 2 runs, turn and bounce for Babar, Rahim handles it well, steering it wide of slip for a couple

34.3   Babar to Rahim, FOUR, that has been given as runs. Drifting down leg, Rahim looked like he had missed it. Deflected off the thigh pad I suppose and races away to the fence. Umpire gives it as runs though
34.2   Babar to Rahim, no run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Rahim gets forward and blocks
34.1   Babar to Rahim, no run, tossed up outside off, Rahim defends with an open face to backward point, they don't risk the single

33.6   Azhar Ali to Soumya Sarkar, SIX, Soumya Sarkar is all smiles as he brings up his maiden ODI ton. Dragged down short from Azhar Ali, a gift and Soumya Sarkar latches on. Rocks back and pulls over deep mid-wicket. Had to clear the fielder and did so. Knew as soon as he hit it that it was his moment. Swings the bat wildly in celebration. Takes the helmet off and has a word with Rahim
Slip added now
33.5   Azhar Ali to Soumya Sarkar, no run, another googly and Soumya Sarkar doesn't read it well, gets forward to defend and the extra bounce beats the forward defence. Lovely delivery but no edge

33.4   Azhar Ali to Soumya Sarkar, no run, tentative from Soumya Sarkar that time, googly from Azhar Ali, keeps a bit low, Soumya Sarkar turns to leg and gets an inside edge onto the pads. That could've gone anywhere
33.3   Azhar Ali to Rahim, 1 run, low full toss on the stumps, Rahim digs it out to mid-on, quick single taken
33.2   Azhar Ali to Rahim, no run, bit of turn for Azhar Ali, Rahim defends cautiously to point
33.1   Azhar Ali to Rahim, no run, tossed up outside off, Rahim gets forward and defends to point
Azhar Ali, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack
32.6   Babar to Rahim, 1 run, tossed up outside off, Rahim gets forward to defend and gets a thick inside edge to short fine leg, takes the single
32.5   Babar to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, flat outside off, punched off the back foot to long-on
32.4   Babar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, waits for the ball to turn in and then nudges it to square leg
32.3   Babar to Rahim, 1 run, well tossed up on the stumps, Rahim gets forward and drives to long-off
32.2   Babar to Rahim, FOUR, Rahim uses his feet and smashes the drive to deep extra cover, hit all along the ground and hits the gap
32.1   Babar to Rahim, no run, flatter and outside off, Rahim defends off the back foot wide of silly point

That will be drinks. Soumya Sarkar has batted brilliantly and it will only take a miracle from Pakistan to pull this game out of the hat. Bangladesh have all the momentum and the crowd behind them and look unstoppable in this series.
31.6   Riaz to Soumya Sarkar, no run, dug in short and Soumya Sarkar half ducks to let it go
31.5   Riaz to Soumya Sarkar, no run, slower delivery on off, Soumya Sarkar gets forward and looks to drive hard, mistimed to mid-off

31.4   Riaz to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR, Soumya Sarkar is taking on every bowler and is putting them to the sword. On a back of a length on off, he is quick to rock back and muscles the pull over mid-wicket. Moves to 94
31.3   Riaz to Rahim, 1 run, good length on off, Rahim opens the face of the bat and runs it down to third man
Just a slip in place
31.2   Riaz to Rahim, no run, short of length on off, defended from the crease
31.1   Riaz to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, short outside off, Soumya Sarkar ramps and ensures he keeps it down in front of the fielder, doesn't carry to third man
Wahab Riaz [4.0-0-18-0] is back into the attack
30.6   Babar to Rahim, no run, short and wide outside off, turning away, cut straight to the fielder at point. Missed out there
30.5   Babar to Rahim, no run, pushed through on off, Rahim in defending gets a thick inside edge onto the pads. Babar felt that he nearly got through there
30.4   Babar to Rahim, no run, flatter on middle and leg, Rahim defends and defends late

30.3   Babar to Rahim, 2 runs, Babar almost gets Rahim. The keeper going over cover and just about clears a leaping Saad Nasim. Mistimed and Rahim got lucky as the fielder running back didn't get a finger on it
30.2   Babar to Rahim, no run, flighted delivery on the stumps, Rahim defends
30.1   Babar to Rahim, no run, tossed up outside off, Rahim drives in the air but falls short of cover. Not too wide of short cover as well

29.6   Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR, take that Junaid Khan says Soumya Sarkar. Charges the bowler and hits it over his head. Much more of a clean strike that and a couple of bounces before it races away to the ropes

29.5   Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR, Soumya Sarkar swings over mid-on and gets a boundary. On a length and outside off, Soumya Sarkar wants to finish it off quickly. That was cross-batted but got enough elevation to clear mid-on
29.4   Junaid Khan to Rahim, 1 run, good length outside off, Rahim gets forward and dabs to cover, wide of the fielder and single taken

29.3   Junaid Khan to Rahim, FOUR, that has raced away to third man, good length outside off, Rahim opens the face of the bat and steers very late past the lone slip, raced across the turf, third man ran across and didn't dive
29.2   Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, angled in on the stumps, flicked wide of mid-on for a quick single
29.1   Junaid Khan to Rahim, 1 run, good length on middle, Rahim closes the face of the bat and tucks it through mid-wicket for a single
28.6   Babar to Rahim, 1 run, flighted delivery outside off, Rahim gets forward and drives to long-off for a single
28.5   Babar to Rahim, no run, fired in quicker, Rahim lunges out to defend to off
28.4   Babar to Rahim, no run, and again, flatter on the stumps, Rahim defends off the back foot
28.3   Babar to Rahim, no run, Rahim wants to come forward but isn't allowed to do so by Babar, defended with an open face to point
28.2   Babar to Rahim, no run, tossed up outside off, Rahim gets forward and drives to the right of short cover, bit of confusion between the batsmen but they don't risk the quick single
Three men around the bat for Rahim
28.1   Babar to Rahim, no run, flatter and turns away, Rahim handles that off the back foot
27.6   Junaid Khan to Rahim, 1 run, back of a length on the hips, tucked away to deep backward square leg for a single
Mushfiqur Rahim, right handed bat, comes to the crease

27.5   Junaid Khan to Mahmudullah, out Bowled!! Good comeback by Junaid Khan. He bowls Mahmudullah out. Pitched up on off, went through the shot of Mahmudullah who was aiming for a drive on the rise. The ball sneaks between bat and pad to hit the top of off. Junaid Khan exults. Mahmudullah b Junaid Khan 4(10) [4s-1]
Junaid Khan to Mahmudullah, THATS OUT!! Bowled!!

27.4   Junaid Khan to Mahmudullah, FOUR, Mahmudullah puts away the free-hit to the deep mid-wicket fence. Very full on the stumps, Mahmudullah cleared his front leg and then hoicked it over mid-wicket. One bounce and over the ropes. Sweetly struck
Free-hit. Junaid Khan round the wicket to Mahmudullah
27.4   Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, no ball, 1 run, Junaid Khan oversteps and Soumya Sarkar plays a fine drive on the rise to sweeper cover, single taken
27.3   Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, 2 runs, short of length outside off, Soumya Sarkar stands tall and cracks it square of the wicket, for a couple
Fawad Alam helps out Soumya Sarkar with his bat grip

27.2   Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, no run, Rizwan is appealing for everything, even when he knows there is no edge. Soumya Sarkar using his feet and missing a swipe to a length ball, the ball flies over the stumps. Daylight between bat and ball
27.1   Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, no run, shortish on the stumps, Soumya Sarkar rocks back and pulls but mid-wicket goes to his left to field. That was mistimed as well

26.6   Babar to Mahmudullah, no run, loud shout for lbw but the height would've been an issue there. The slider from Babar, Mahmudullah misses the forward defence and is hit on the back leg, bouncing over. The umpire shakes his head and Pakistan don't have any reviews left
26.5   Babar to Mahmudullah, no run, sliding down leg, Mahmudullah flicks and misses. There are three men close-in now, with a silly point added to the fray
26.4   Babar to Mahmudullah, no run, that has hit the bat splice and fallen in the vacant silly point region. Extra bounce for Babar as Mahmudullah pushed forward to defend
26.3   Babar to Mahmudullah, no run, very full on middle and leg, Mahmudullah eases it back to Babar
26.2   Babar to Mahmudullah, no run, that keeps a bit low, Mahmudullah handles it well and keeps it out
Slip and a short leg. Now round the wicket
26.1   Babar to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, tossed up outside off, Soumya Sarkar slog sweeps hard to deep mid-wicket, hit hard and the fielder did well to get across to that
25.6   Junaid Khan to Mahmudullah, no run, that has pitched outside leg and can't be given out lbw. Raps Mahmudullah on the thigh pad. Height would've been a factor as well

25.5   Junaid Khan to Mahmudullah, no run, that is a fine delivery from Junaid Khan, pushes this good length delivery across Mahmudullah who stayed in the crease and flirted out. Nearly feathered it through
25.4   Junaid Khan to Mahmudullah, no run, short of length on off, Mahmudullah wrists it to the right of the bowler
Mahmudullah, right handed bat, comes to the crease

25.3   Junaid Khan to Tamim, out Lbw!! Nips back in and beats Tamim's attempted dab to third man. Was too close to be playing that and Tamim pays for his cheekiness. It struck him in line and the original decision will stand. Hitting the stumps as the replays showed. Tamim lbw b Junaid Khan 64(76) [4s-8 6s-1]
Junaid Khan to Tamim, THATS OUT!! Lbw!!
Tamim has been given out lbw. But he is reviewing it. Looks out at first glance. Pad first and impact seems to be in line as well. Umpire's call and Pakistan have got their first wicket

25.2   Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, this back of a length delivery hurries onto Soumya Sarkar and his pull eludes mid-wicket running back. Falls in no-man's land. Soumya Sarkar completely mistimed that

25.1   Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR, very poor from Junaid Khan and Soumya Sarkar puts him away. Short and down leg, sat up to be hit and Soumya Sarkar pulls hard to the deep backward square leg fence. It didn't bounce high to trouble Sarkar
24.6   Babar to Tamim, no run, flighted outside off, Tamim dabs it in front of cover, wants a quick single, Soumya Sarkar isn't interested
24.5   Babar to Tamim, no run, tossed up outside off, Tamim gets forward and wrists it to mid-wicket

24.4   Babar to Tamim, FOUR, whatever Soumya Sarkar can do, Tamim says he can emulate him. He does just that with a reverse sweep, gloving it wide of the short third fielder, Gul gave chase but he was beaten to the ball
24.3   Babar to Tamim, 2 runs, Tamim takes it from outside off and paddles it fine to fine leg, for a couple
24.2   Babar to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, Soumya Sarkar uses his feet and wrists it to long-on
Now round the wicket

24.1   Babar to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR, Soumya Sarkar shows off his wide array of strokes. Sees the tossed up delivery outside off and reverse sweeps wide of backward point. Played all along the ground and gets it in the gap. Superbly executed
23.6   Junaid Khan to Tamim, no run, short of length on off, no room to work with for Tamim who dabs to backward point

23.5   Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, tries to repeat the blow and almost holes out. Length delivery on the stumps, Soumya Sarkar went for a cross-batted slog and got enough to clear mid-on running back. Soumya Sarkar got lucky there

23.4   Junaid Khan to Soumya Sarkar, SIX, Soumya Sarkar is making the crowd go mad with his daredevilry batting. Charges Junaid Khan and then slogs the pacer over long-on. More of a pre-meditated hit that but Soumya Sarkar emerged victor

23.3   Junaid Khan to Tamim, 1 run, good length outside off, Tamim comes down the track and slashes hard, the ball flies away to third man, Tamim's body twisted in all directions as he gave it his all

23.2   Junaid Khan to Tamim, no run, good length on off, Tamim gets forward and defends solidly to cover. What do we have here? Pakistan reckon that it was pad first and review for an lbw. It wasn't a big appeal as well from Pakistan. Impact - umpire's call and Tamim will stay. Pakistan waste a review. That is sheer desperation as Pakistan look for an elusive breakthrough
23.1   Junaid Khan to Tamim, no run, short of length on the stumps, Tamim brings the bat down late and defends to short mid-wicket
Junaid Khan [3.0-0-19-0] is back into the attack
22.6   Babar to Tamim, 1 run, pushed to the right of the bowler for a quick single, Tamim and Soumya Sarkar harrying the Pakistanis
22.5   Babar to Tamim, no run, turned to short leg
22.4   Babar to Tamim, no run, tossed up on the stumps, Tamim gets forward and defends

22.3   Babar to Tamim, FOUR, now Tamim is looking to entertain. Skips out and slices the lofted hit over mid-off. Got it over the man and it's an easy boundary. He is making batting look easy at the moment
22.2   Babar to Tamim, no run, shortish on the stumps, punched off the back foot to mid-wicket
22.1   Babar to Tamim, FOUR, 50 for Tamim. After two tons in the series. Spinning down leg, Tamim got a feather on the sweep and gets it fine, runs away to the fence. The crowd clear their throats
21.6   Hafeez to Tamim, 1 run, comes down the track and lofts on the bounce to long-off, wanted to go over cover but hit it straighter
21.5   Hafeez to Tamim, no run, looks for a drop and run to short cover, but Soumya Sarkar isn't interested, sends his partner back, the fielder was to the ball quickly

21.4   Hafeez to Tamim, SIX, now Tamim gives Hafeez the treatment. Comes down and hits it inside out over cover. Got to the pitch and timed it really well, all the way over the ropes. Tamim moves to 47 with that meaty blow
21.3   Hafeez to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, flighted outside off, Soumya Sarkar gets forward and eases it to sweeper cover

21.2   Hafeez to Soumya Sarkar, SIX, Soumya Sarkar breaks the shackles with a big hit. Charges Hafeez and swings across the line over deep mid-wicket. Went miles back as Soumya Sarkar connected really well with the shot
21.1   Hafeez to Soumya Sarkar, no run, flatter and Soumya Sarkar defends off the back foot

20.6   Babar to Tamim, no run, definite dropped catch. Tamim lunging out to flick and getting an inside edge, it looped to short leg who leapt and couldn't hold on, despite getting both hands. The fielder tried his best but the ball eluded him. Pakistan needed that
20.5   Babar to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, Soumya Sarkar uses his feet and clips with the turn to fine leg, for a single
20.4   Babar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, flatter and on the stumps, Soumya Sarkar defends off the back foot to mid-wicket
Slip and a short leg in
20.3   Babar to Tamim, 1 run, tossed up on the stumps, Tamim kneels down and sweeps softly to fine leg, controlled shot
20.2   Babar to Tamim, no run, turn and bounce for Babar, Tamim stretches out to defend and is hit on the body

20.1   Babar to Tamim, no run, the ball spins and turns in, Tamim shoulders arms and allows to hit him on the body. Runs away to fine leg, they take the single but rightly the umpire signals dead ball for the batsman didn't play a shot
19.6   Hafeez to Tamim, 1 run, flighted delivery outside off, driven off the front foot to long-off
19.5   Hafeez to Tamim, no run, flatter on off, Tamim gets forward and blocks it back down the track
19.4   Hafeez to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run, tossed up on the stumps, Soumya Sarkar gets forward and drives to long-on

19.3   Hafeez to Soumya Sarkar, no run, uses his feet and flicks, gets an inside edge onto the pads, the ball rolls to mid-wicket, sent back by Tamim and Soumya Sarkar makes it in time, beating the direct hit

18.5   Babar to Tamim, no run, turning in, Tamim clips it to backward square leg

18.2   Babar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, Babar dragged the length back as he saw the batsman advancing, Soumya Sarkar defends
Just a slip in place
18.1   Babar to Soumya Sarkar, no run, tossed up outside off, Soumya Sarkar gets forward and wrists it to short mid-wicket
Zulfiqar Babar, left-arm orthodox, comes into the attack
17.6   Hafeez to Tamim, no run, another false stroke, Tamim looking to flick and gets a leading edge that goes to ground, to point
17.5   Hafeez to Tamim, no run, Tamim comes down the track and gets an inside edge onto the pads. Hafeez appealed for an lbw but Tamim got bat on the shot

Welcome back. The Pakistani team is in a huddle. Hafeez has the new ball in his hand. His action was cleared yesterday and straightaway he's into action.
Don't go too far. Do stay tuned for we will be back in a jiffy

The openers put on 91 and gave a solid platform. It was built on by Azhar Ali and Haris Sohail and the captain promptly got his maiden ODI ton. At that stage it looked like Pakistan will get 300 minimum. But the fall of Azhar Ali's wicket changed the complexion. Good captaincy by Mashrafe though for he kept attacking and backed his bowlers with aggressive fields. All the bowlers chipped in. We saw Tamim come out all guns blazing in the last ODI. Will we see the same today? Find out pretty soon when Bangladesh walk out to chase.

So Pakistan have collapsed to 250 all out. They were 202/2 and going strong when Azhar Ali reached his hundred. But his wicket has sparked a meltdown of the innings. The last eight wickets going for 47 runs in 10.3 overs. Inexplicable really. Now Pakistan have a task on their hand to avert the 'Banglawash' as Athar Ali Khan puts it. The bowling wasn't out of the ordinary nor was the pitch playing tricks. Poor shots and lack of common sense from the middle-order has seen Pakistan waste all the good work done in the first 38 overs.

Mortaza: "We would've looked to bat first. But last game we bowled brilliantly. Boys are looking forward to this game. We are not looking forward to 3-0 but hope to play well like the last two games, the result will come. No changes."

Azhar Ali: "We are going to bat first. It looks quite slow and it might not come onto the bat. We will look to get runs on the board. We have to improve big time in every aspect of the game. Everyone know that and we will look to correct that today. Sarfraz is resting and we have three changes. Sami Aslam is making his debut. It is a big challenge for me and the whole team is behind me and supporting me."
Pitch report: A different pitch today. But quite similar to the one that were used for the first two ODIs. A bit of cracks but still a good batting pitch.
Teams:
Bangladesh (Playing XI): Tamim Iqbal, Soumya Sarkar, Mahmudullah, Mushfiqur Rahim(w), Shakib Al Hasan, Sabbir Rahman, Nasir Hossain, Mashrafe Mortaza(c), Arafat Sunny, Taskin Ahmed, Rubel Hossain
Pakistan (Playing XI): Azhar Ali(c), Mohammad Hafeez, Haris Sohail, Fawad Alam, Mohammad Rizwan(w), Saad Nasim, Sami Aslam, Wahab Riaz, Umar Gul, Junaid Khan, Zulfiqar Babar

Pakistan have made three changes to the team that lost the last game. Out go Rahat Ali, Sarfraz Ahmed and Saeed Ajmal. In come Umar Gul, Zulfiqar Babar and there is a debut for Sami Aslam. Bangladesh are unchanged.
Pakistan have won the toss and have opted to bat
Toss and teams coming up in a short while. Do stay tuned...

The form of Tamim Iqbal for Bangladesh has been a huge plus. He has notched up consecutive hundreds in the series and will be trying to become the first Bangladeshi to make three in a row today. He clinically dismantled the Pakistani attack in the last game, taking on the opening bowlers with calculated hitting. His onslaught set the platform for an easy win. For Pakistan Umar Gul has been drafted in as a replacement for Ehsan Adil. He should get a look in today and it will be interesting to see how he goes.

Pakistan are undergoing a transition phase after the World Cup. For this series they are without Misbah and Afridi - who have retired from ODIs. They have a new captain in Azhar Ali who is yet to find his bearings. So the losses in the first two games isn't a huge shock considering how Bangladesh have been playing ever since the World Cup. The injuries to players like Sohaib Maqsood, Sohail Khan, Yasir Shah and Ehsan Adil hasn't helped the side too.

Shakib said before the series began that they will be favorites. A lot of them laughed at that statement. After two matches and with the series sealed in favor of his side, it is Shakib who is doing all the laughing. Pakistan have been outplayed in both games as the hosts won their first ever ODI series. A warm welcome to the final game of this series as Bangladesh attempt a rare shot at a whitewash.
Teams:

Pakistan (From): Azhar Ali(c), Sarfraz Ahmed(w), Mohammad Hafeez, Haris Sohail, Fawad Alam, Mohammad Rizwan, Saad Nasim, Wahab Riaz, Umar Gul, Saeed Ajmal, Junaid Khan, Rahat Ali, Sami Aslam, Asad Shafiq, Zulfiqar Babar

Bangladesh (From): Tamim Iqbal, Soumya Sarkar, Mahmudullah, Mushfiqur Rahim(w), Shakib Al Hasan, Sabbir Rahman, Nasir Hossain, Mashrafe Mortaza(c), Arafat Sunny, Rubel Hossain, Taskin Ahmed, Mominul Haque, Abul Hasan, Rony Talukdar
